#summary How to install webapp under Linux.

== 1. Install Apache2 ==

_Notice: If you install Apache2 after staff, you need to recompile and reinstall staff to enable Apache2-specific modules. Restart Apache2 after reinstalling staff._

You must know the directory where Apache2 stores html documents. Usually it is one of the following addresses: 
{{{
/var/www
/www/htdocs
}}}

For the convenience use the environment variable
{{{
export WWWSAMPLE=/var/www/webapp-sample/
mkdir -p $WWWSAMPLE
}}}

Copy the webapp and examples from svn:
{{{
cd $WWWSAMPLE
svn export --force http://staff.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/webapp/webclient/samples .
svn export --force http://staff.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/webapp/webclient/webapp webapp
}}}

== 2. Install Yahoo UI ==

Download YahooUI 2.x (Full developer kit) from http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/2/

Unzip the contents of the directory `build` to `$WWWSAMPLE/yui`.

== 3. Testing ==

Test the basic web application. 

Application Server Axis2/C and Apache2 web server must be running. Open the page in the browser (Firefox):

http://localhost/webapp-sample/main.htm?profile=webapp_sample

Web application sample must load.

Click menu item "Widgets" => "Add", select "Sample widget: Button" and click "OK", select "center", click "OK".

Sample widget "Button" must appear.
